body:
I masked stuff together and I edited the lighting and whatnot. What do you guys think, does it look like a believable movie poster or nah? :)



Made this for my Digital Imaging class. Took about 2-3 hours.
body_tagged:
I masked stuff together and I edited the lighting and whatnot. What do you guys think, does it look like a believable movie poster or nah? :)



Made this for my Digital Imaging class. Took about 2-3 hours.
title: Made this with Photoshop

replies.body:
thats pretty nice but not good enough to be a believable movie poster.
the girl does not look like she  fits into the rest of the picture, the fonts dont really fit in with the poster, the looks like its been erased around the edges which downgrades the quality of the video. if you looked at other posters for refference you could tell the placement of some of the things are a bit wrong.

just a couple of things to take into account, of course the poster is not gonna be perfect at first buts its a good start :P

replies.body: have you never seen what the words at the bottom of a movie poster look like?
replies.body_tagged: have you never seen what the words at the bottom of a movie poster look like?

replies.body: Make all the bottom text WAAAY smaller and center it. Also perhaps darken the blue of the text a bit.
replies.body_tagged: Make all the bottom text WAAAY smaller and center it. Also perhaps darken the blue of the text a bit.

replies.body: The red behind the text is too much contrast. For the theme it looks like you are going for stick with blues and whites.
replies.body_tagged: The red behind the text is too much contrast. For the theme it looks like you are going for stick with blues and whites.

replies.body: No, because I don't buy movies - I watch them on Netflix :T
